page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: Our block is an area of almost entirely agricultural land with few settlements. Only two settlements of any size are to be found, these being the villages of Hilmarton and Goatacre, with only part of the latter falling within the block. The only major road which passes through the block is the A.3102, which passes in a north/south direction. It crosses the only major water source, Cowage Brook, at the southern end of Goatacre. To the north and west of the village of Hilmarton, which is found centrally in the block, the land rises to a height of 125 metres near Catcomb Farm. To the south and east, although gradually rising, the land has a far gentler slope to it. The only shop in the block is the local store/post office in Hilmarton.
